thread.title: Why Kirk Cousins Makes the Vikings a Bit Top Heavy

author: Michael Salfino
title: Why Kirk Cousins Makes the Vikings a Bit Top Heavy
text:
The Minnesota Vikings made their Super Bowl intentions clear, with the signing of free-agent quarterback Kirk Cousins. But the win-now move brings urgency to the 2018 season since their salary-cap crunch goes from bad to worse in a hurry.
Cousinsâ€™s $84 million guaranteed contract spread out over the next three years makes the Vikings unusually top heavy in 2018, with their top 10 highest-paid players accounting for about $112 million. Last season when they won 13 games with quarterback Case Keenum earning just $1.9 million... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
